REPORTS TO: Front Office Manager
Purpose for the Position: To check in and out guests to the hotel, ensure proper room and miscellaneous postings, secure credit, answer questions, answer telephones, provide maximum levels of guest service and support the hotel's rooms division in anyway required to ensure complete guest satisfaction.
Essential Responsibilities:
Greet, register, and assign rooms to guests of hotel.
Verify customers' credit, and establish how the customer will pay for the accommodation.
Keep records of room availability and guests' accounts using computerized property management systems.
Compute bills, collect payments, and make change for guests.
Perform simple bookkeeping activities, such as balancing cash accounts.
Issue room keys and escort instructions to bellmen.
Review accounts and charges with guests during the check out process.
Post charges, such those for rooms, food, liquor, or telephone calls, to ledgers manually, or by using computers.
Transmit and receive messages, using telephones or telephone switchboards.
Contact housekeeping or maintenance staff when guests report problems.
Make and confirm reservations.
Answer inquiries pertaining to hotel services, registration of guests, and shopping, dining, entertainment, and travel directions.
Record guest comments or complaints, referring customers to managers as necessary.
Advise housekeeping staff when rooms have been vacated and are ready for cleaning.
Answer all incoming phones in three or less rings.
Complete "bucket checks" to ensure all accounts are current and comply with standards established by the hotel's controller and front office manager.
To do this kind of work, you must be able to:
Be an outgoing, welcoming personality for the Hotel
Use logical thinking and personal judgment to perform a variety of office tasks that require special skills and knowledge.
Make decisions based on your own judgment and company policy.
Follow instructions without close supervision.
Speak and write clearly and accurately.
Be available for work days, evenings, weekends and holidays.
Physical Demands: Lifting 10 lbs. maximum and occasionally lifting and/or carrying such articles as dockets, ledgers, and small tools. Walking and standing are required throughout the shift. Reaching, handling, feeling, talking, hearing, and seeing.
Environmental Conditions: Inside: Protection from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes. A job is considered "inside" if the worker spends approximately 75% or more of the time inside.
Math Skills: Requires mathematical development sufficient to be able to: Compute discount, interest, profit and loss, commission, markups and selling price, ratio and proportion, and percentages. Calculate surface, volumes, weights and measures.
Language Skills: Must have developed language skills to the point to be able to: Read newspapers, periodicals, journals, and manuals. Write business letters, summaries and reports using prescribed format and conforming to all rules of punctuation, grammar, diction and style. Participate in discussions and debates. Speak extemporaneously on a variety of subjects.
Relationships to Data, People and Things:
Data: Compiling: Gathering, collating, or classifying information about data, people or things. Reporting and/or carrying out a prescribed action in relation to the information is frequently involved.
People: Speaking-Signaling: Talking with and/or signaling people to convey or exchange information. Includes giving assignments and or directions to helpers or assistants.
Things: Operating-Controlling: Starting, stopping, controlling and adjusting the progress of machines or equipment. Operating machines involves setting up and adjusting the machine or materials as the work progresses. Controlling involves observing and turning devices to regulate reactions of materials.
Specific Vocational Preparation: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Professional with an emphasis on Word, PowerPoint and Excel to format and create professional documents to be used and distributed on the executive level. Candidate must have strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize duties to complete within required deadlines. Creativity to accomplish required tasks, such as documents being appealing to the eye, to find and research various information needed to complete and compile reports.

Overview of AJWS
American Jewish World Service (AJWS) is the leading Jewish organization working to fight poverty and pursue justice in the developing world. By supporting hundreds of social change organizations in 19 countries, we respond to the most pressing issues of our time—from disasters, genocide and hunger, to the persecution of women and minorities worldwide. With Jewish values and a global reach, AJWS is making a difference in millions of lives and bringing a more just and equitable world closer for all.
Overview of the Position
The Risk Management and Administrative Services department, a part of the Finance and Administration Division, is responsible for a broad range of organizational operations and processes, which allow AJWS to run effectively, operate efficiently and manage risk thoughtfully. The team oversees risk management, domestic and international safety and security, commercial insurances, organizational legal compliance, shipping and mail services, and reception. They also manage the facilities and physical space for all of AJWS’ offices and hold the centralized systems for contract processing and travel management.
This position, reporting to the Facilities Manager, represents the face of AJWS at the New York headquarter office. It staffs our reception area and handles operational and administrative tasks that ensure a smooth functioning of the office. This position is required to arrive at the office an hour earlier than the general office hours and can leave the office an hour early. The first hour is spent ensuring the office is in order for business.
The job responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Reception
Staff the AJWS front office/reception at AJWS’s New York office;
Maintain a clean and welcoming reception area with appropriate décor and appropriate AJWS material in the waiting area;
Greet and communicate with visitors in a professional, courteous and hospitable manner including handling coat check services, storing umbrellas and bags in closets, offering water and beverages, and informing staff of their visitor’s arrival;
Maintain accurate and complete sign-in/sign-out procedures for visitors;
Maintain up-to-date basic knowledge of AJWS’s business, mission, projects, programs, leadership etc. and be able to answer basic questions in person and over the phone about these topics;
Maintain and provide driving, parking and public transportation directions to all AJWS’s office locations, area restaurants, area health clinics etc.;
Maintain readily accessible list of phone numbers for taxis and food delivery services and be able to call taxi services for staff and visitors;
Answer multi-line phones with ease, direct incoming calls to appropriate staff and make outgoing calls as required;
Monitor visitor access and maintain security awareness around the reception area at all times;
Stay conversant with AJWS’s site security plan and respond as needed in security situations; and
Acquire and maintain knowledge of personnel whereabouts and provide information when required.
Administrative Support
Undertake routine purchases for the organization including basic office supplies and pantry supplies;
Stock pantries on all three floors of the office with supplies;
Purchase/order meals and snacks from catering services for organization-wide meetings as required;
Receive mail, packages, sign for special mail and deliveries as required and ensure packages are picked up by relevant staff while ensuring that a chain of custody is maintained;
Ensure outgoing special mail left at reception is picked up by mail services on time and that relevant staff is informed of late/delayed pick-ups;
Assist in setting up conference rooms before and after meetings as needed
Assist with onsite event planning as needed;
Process invoices and expense reports for various vendors including AJWS lease payments, office suppliers, pantry suppliers, utilities etc. as directed;
Monitor use of AJWS wellness room and staff adherence to guidelines for use
Under directions from Director, RMAS ,
Provide staff support and monitoring of AJWS travel tool (Concur) to ensure compliance of AJWS travel policy
Solicit travel plans from AJWS staff on a regular basis, enter travel information into the travel tracker and send them to AJWS’s travel risk management partner (Global Rescue) in a timely manner to populate the Global Risk Intelligence Directory (GRID);
Enter travel information in Outlook calendars of AJWS staff responsible for safety and security of travelers;
Schedule pre-trip check-ins for traveling staff with the Administrative Services Manager;
Issue insurance certificates for AJWS staff and ICC’s traveling internationally
Champions the identification and reporting of RMAS operational risks through risk management tools developed by team
Provides monthly updates to RMAS Newsletter
Assist in any other operational and administrative support tasks as required.
Qualifications
B. A. degree or an equivalent combination of education and education
1+ years of experience in basic administrative support
Must be able to function well in a fast-paced work environment, able to respond to multiple requests for assistance simultaneously
Experience using communication systems like projector, audio visual devices, mikes
Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a flexible and collaborative spirit
Ability to exercise sound judgment and work effectively with personnel, visitors, donors and vendors
Ability to prioritize and work under deadlines
Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
Willingness to work after hours
Enthusiasm, professionalism and a passion for hospitality management
Commitment to building warm and collegial relationships with staff at many different levels
High level of emotional intelligence with a positive outlook and a good sense of humor
Strong commitment to AJWS’s mission and core values
Compensation and Benefits Information

You will offer emotional support and resource materials to grieving clients in a compassionate and discreet manner.
You serve as a liaison between clients and service agencies during handling of pet remains by ensuring a complete, accurate, and compassionate process.

MAJOR DUTIES:
Works at the first floor reception desk, maintains control of all people entering the building.
Greets visitors, determines the purpose of their business, and contacts the appropriate staff member with whom they are meeting.
Ensures that they sign the visitor confidentiality form.
Meets residents returning from trips outside the building, inspects any packages or items that are being brought into the building.
Observes clients’ demeanor to help identify anyone who may be intoxicated.
Registers clients’ return and time of return in the appropriate log sheet.
Allows or delays clients’ return to the program as needed.
Monitors live video feed, maintains aware of activity outside the building.
Maintains awareness of area, reports any unusual circumstances or conditions.
Answers incoming phone calls and directs them to the appropriate extension.
Receives mail or packages, and forwards to appropriate staff.

Keep track of Medicaid token for clients by entering name, date and # of tokens given to each client on a daily basis in a log book.
Assist Office Manager with creating schedules, updating groups and adding new staff schedules and discharging clients in computer.
Update Appointment Book on a daily basis keeping the schedule two weeks ahead at all times.
Input daily group sheets and individual sessions on a daily basis with totals faxed to fiscal at the end of each night along with verifying clinical staff members on the computerized system.
Input, update and track OASAS admission/discharge forms on a monthly basis.
Run group sheets on a daily basis.
Track urine drug screens on a daily basis by logging them in the appropriate manual.
Making new charts on all new admissions to outpatient and breakdown of discharged clients into manila folders.
Perform all other duties as assigned.

In addition, you would ensure that the patient has an excellent service experience.
Responsibilities

Answer multiple line and multiple language telephone lines.
Schedule appointments and accommodate patient appointment needs, such as ordering transportation, rescheduling, etc.
Contact insurance companies to verify eligibility.
Perform clerical work as needed, i.e., copying, filing, faxing, etc.
Comply with patient needs at all time and ensure all questions are answered.
Maintain procedure rooms by ensuring that they are neat and ready for use at all times.
Assist doctors during Endovenous Laser Therapy procedures in accordance with instructions and individual doctor preferences.
Prepare patients before procedures and clean up after.
Ensure patient receipt of post-procedure instructions and how to obtain medication if needed.
Monitor supply levels and replace as needed.
Train new staff as needed.
Assist ultrasound staff as needed.
Transport supplies or equipment as needed.

Position Overview
The receptionist receives incoming calls, determines the nature of each call and directs the caller to the appropriate person or department. Answers basic inquiries and takes messages.
What are the day-to-day responsibilities?
Meet and greet customers in a professional manner
Operate switchboard telephone system
Communicate with callers in a professional, friendly and efficient manner, striving to minimize the amount of time spent on hold
Take thorough messages, indicating the callers first and last name, company name if applicable, the time and the message the caller wishes to leave
Provide basic information to callers who have general inquires
Assist with filing duties and other administrative tasks as needed
Prepare sales and service gas tickets for the Accounting Department
Serve as a backup to the Sales Department Cashier
Assist the General Manager with various clerical duties as needed
Attend meetings and trainings as scheduled
Perform other duties as assigned
Be friendly, professional, courteous and efficient when working with all customers and employees
What are the requirements for this job?
High School diploma or equivalent
Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to operate a multi-line switchboard
Ability to read and comprehend instructions and information
Ability to work well with the public

The Receptionist is responsible for managing visitors and telephone inquiries at the Foundation’s New York office providing a positive experience. In addition, the Receptionist will support the Operations team, and other departments as assigned, with their administrative needs. In order to properly respond to inquiries from a wide range of internal and external parties, the Receptionist must be well-versed in the Foundation’s programs, office services and operations, as well as internal policies and procedures. In many cases, the Receptionist will be the first point of contact for guests, providing a professional demeanor and strong customer service will have a direct impact on the image of the Foundation. Temporary position for September 16, 2019 to December 20, 2019.
Responsibilities
Professionally respond to all incoming telephone calls and directs calls to the appropriate party when needed according to the Foundation’s policies and procedures.
Greet visitors in a professional, friendly, and hospitable manner. Accommodate any special needs of guests (i.e. guests with wheelchairs, and/or other disabilities) while always providing exceptional customer service. Assist in maintaining a secure office environment by collaborating with the Director of Operations & Security to ensure that no inappropriate visitors enter the office.
Assist in maintaining the appearance of the New York Office by maintaining common areas such as the reception area, conference rooms, the Hub, and office supply rooms.
Provide administrative support to the Operations team and other departments with approval of Director, Technical Support & Operations.
Provides facilities support including routine maintenance requests such as adjusting the HVAC system, procurement of office supplies.

Preferred: Bachelor’s Degree
2. Work Experience:

Ability to hanlde challenging situations with diplomacy and tact.
4. Special Skills:
Excellent phone etiquette
Strong Microsoft Office skills
Good detail-orientation and follow-up ability
Physical and Other Requirements

Join The Doe Fund on our mission to break the cycles of homelessness, addiction, and criminal recidivism by providing holistic services, housing and work opportunities to the under-served populations including the formerly homeless and incarcerated, disconnected youth, veterans, and people living with AIDS. Our flagship transitional work program- Ready, Willing & Able- integrates paid work, occupational training, and holistic supportive services to facilitate an individual’s return to mainstream society.
We are currently seeking an energetic, self-motivated and experienced Administrative Assistant for The Doe Fund's newest permanent supportive housing program for homeless men and women living with HIV/AIDS. The program is designed to provide long-term residential care and twenty-four hour support services in a community environment that maximizes residents' independence while ensuring their physical and emotional security and well-being. Seventy-four units will be allocated for residents referred by the New York City HIV/AIDS Services Administration (HASA) and forty-nine apartments will be for families referred by the New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA).

The Studio School is seeking a Receptionist who can create a welcoming environment while working independently and proactively, and on multiple projects at the same time. The Receptionist establishes rapport and maintains harmonious working relationships with administrators, teachers, staff members, families and students. We seek a Receptionist who is at ease and effective working in a fast-paced work environment that requires engaging regularly with students and families across multiple areas, supporting our Head of School and other senior staff members, collaborating with faculty and staff, and competently completing and troubleshooting routine and emergent tasks. It’s crucial that the Receptionist bring expertise, initiative, warmth, patience, energy, good judgment, and flexibility to the role and our community. Of great importance, the Receptionist serves as the first point of contact in many situations and is the gatekeeper of the health and safety of our students.

 Maintain security by watching the entrance and security monitors, screening visitors, and observing the students’ arrival and departure from school

 Greet, welcome, and direct visitors

 Maintain a copier room, interview room, lobby, administrative suite, and small staff kitchenette

 Coordinate mailings and other correspondences

 Maintain a neat, orderly Reception desk

 Excellent interpersonal skills, including cultural competency to interact warmly, sensitively, and effectively in a diverse community of students, parents/guardians, faculty, alumni, staff, and visitors

 Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple, varied tasks with confidence, competence, efficiency, and good spirit

ColumbiaDoctors is currently looking for a Front Desk Receptionist for our Tarrytown location. The Front Desk Receptionist will be assigned to provide coverage for the ColumbiaDoctors Tarrytown office. Hours and days may be variable Monday through Friday 7am to 7pm and occasional Saturdays.
Job duties include (but are not limited to):
Check patients in for their appointments which includes verifying/updating patient demographic and insurance information, collecting referrals, performing insurance eligibility/verification, collect and post payments, daily reconciliation of the cash drawer, adding pharmacy to chart, uploading radiology images into LifeImage.
Check patient out which includes scheduling follow up appointments and diagnostic testing, interacting with other departments and facilities to help schedule follow up care, providing patient with appointment card and all necessary instructions to ensure a smooth follow up visit.
Accurately scanning information into CROWN (including but not limited to insurance card, referrals, registration forms, outside records, etc).
Coordinating all clerical aspects of patient flow during the practice session.
Interacting with clinical support staff and providers to ensure a smooth and timely flow of patients through the office
Exercising skill in prioritizing assignments in order to complete work in a timely manner when there are changes in workload, assignments, and pressures of deadlines, competitive requirements and/or a heavy workload.
Maintenance of a cooperative and professional relationship with physicians, nurses, office and clinical staff.
Checking messages and following up with patients (including reminder phone calls) in a timely manner.
Facilitating physician and patient administrative needs
Completes other duties and special projects as assigned.
Conforms to all applicable HIPAA, billing compliance and safety guidelines
Ensures patient centered care by demonstrating behaviors that reflect a Culture of Service and will strive to meet the expectations of the “Seven Competencies” competencies for a “Wow” experience are as follows: Effective Communication, Job Knowledge, Patient Centered Care, Empathy, Collaboration and Teamwork, Pride and Excellence, Integrity and Credibility

REPORTS TO: Front Office Manager
Purpose for the Position: To check in and out guests to the hotel, ensure proper room and miscellaneous postings, secure credit, answer questions, answer telephones, provide maximum levels of guest service and support the hotel's rooms division in anyway required to ensure complete guest satisfaction.
Essential Responsibilities:
Greet, register, and assign rooms to guests of hotel.
Verify customers' credit, and establish how the customer will pay for the accommodation.
Keep records of room availability and guests' accounts using computerized property management systems.
Compute bills, collect payments, and make change for guests.
Perform simple bookkeeping activities, such as balancing cash accounts.
Issue room keys and escort instructions to bellmen.
Review accounts and charges with guests during the check out process.
Post charges, such those for rooms, food, liquor, or telephone calls, to ledgers manually, or by using computers.
Transmit and receive messages, using telephones or telephone switchboards.
Contact housekeeping or maintenance staff when guests report problems.
Make and confirm reservations.
Answer inquiries pertaining to hotel services, registration of guests, and shopping, dining, entertainment, and travel directions.
Record guest comments or complaints, referring customers to managers as necessary.
Advise housekeeping staff when rooms have been vacated and are ready for cleaning.
Answer all incoming phones in three or less rings.
Complete "bucket checks" to ensure all accounts are current and comply with standards established by the hotel's controller and front office manager.
To do this kind of work, you must be able to:
Be an outgoing, welcoming personality for the Hotel
Use logical thinking and personal judgment to perform a variety of office tasks that require special skills and knowledge.
Make decisions based on your own judgment and company policy.
Follow instructions without close supervision.
Speak and write clearly and accurately.
Be available for work days, evenings, weekends and holidays.
Physical Demands: Lifting 10 lbs. maximum and occasionally lifting and/or carrying such articles as dockets, ledgers, and small tools. Walking and standing are required throughout the shift. Reaching, handling, feeling, talking, hearing, and seeing.
Environmental Conditions: Inside: Protection from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes. A job is considered "inside" if the worker spends approximately 75% or more of the time inside.
Math Skills: Requires mathematical development sufficient to be able to: Compute discount, interest, profit and loss, commission, markups and selling price, ratio and proportion, and percentages. Calculate surface, volumes, weights and measures.
Language Skills: Must have developed language skills to the point to be able to: Read newspapers, periodicals, journals, and manuals. Write business letters, summaries and reports using prescribed format and conforming to all rules of punctuation, grammar, diction and style. Participate in discussions and debates. Speak extemporaneously on a variety of subjects.
Relationships to Data, People and Things:
Data: Compiling: Gathering, collating, or classifying information about data, people or things. Reporting and/or carrying out a prescribed action in relation to the information is frequently involved.
People: Speaking-Signaling: Talking with and/or signaling people to convey or exchange information. Includes giving assignments and or directions to helpers or assistants.
Things: Operating-Controlling: Starting, stopping, controlling and adjusting the progress of machines or equipment. Operating machines involves setting up and adjusting the machine or materials as the work progresses. Controlling involves observing and turning devices to regulate reactions of materials.
Specific Vocational Preparation: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Professional with an emphasis on Word, PowerPoint and Excel to format and create professional documents to be used and distributed on the executive level. Candidate must have strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize duties to complete within required deadlines. Creativity to accomplish required tasks, such as documents being appealing to the eye, to find and research various information needed to complete and compile reports.
(ref. 45924)

REPORTS TO: Front Office Manager
Purpose for the Position: To check in and out guests to the hotel, ensure proper room and miscellaneous postings, secure credit, answer questions, answer telephones, provide maximum levels of guest service and support the hotel's rooms division in anyway required to ensure complete guest satisfaction.
Essential Responsibilities:
Greet, register, and assign rooms to guests of hotel.
Verify customers' credit, and establish how the customer will pay for the accommodation.
Keep records of room availability and guests' accounts using computerized property management systems.
Compute bills, collect payments, and make change for guests.
Perform simple bookkeeping activities, such as balancing cash accounts.
Issue room keys and escort instructions to bellmen.
Review accounts and charges with guests during the check out process.
Post charges, such those for rooms, food, liquor, or telephone calls, to ledgers manually, or by using computers.
Transmit and receive messages, using telephones or telephone switchboards.
Contact housekeeping or maintenance staff when guests report problems.
Make and confirm reservations.
Answer inquiries pertaining to hotel services, registration of guests, and shopping, dining, entertainment, and travel directions.
Record guest comments or complaints, referring customers to managers as necessary.
Advise housekeeping staff when rooms have been vacated and are ready for cleaning.
Answer all incoming phones in three or less rings.
Complete "bucket checks" to ensure all accounts are current and comply with standards established by the hotel's controller and front office manager.
To do this kind of work, you must be able to:
Be an outgoing, welcoming personality for the Hotel
Use logical thinking and personal judgment to perform a variety of office tasks that require special skills and knowledge.
Make decisions based on your own judgment and company policy.
Follow instructions without close supervision.
Speak and write clearly and accurately.
Be available for work days, evenings, weekends and holidays.
Physical Demands: Lifting 10 lbs. maximum and occasionally lifting and/or carrying such articles as dockets, ledgers, and small tools. Walking and standing are required throughout the shift. Reaching, handling, feeling, talking, hearing, and seeing.
Environmental Conditions: Inside: Protection from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes. A job is considered "inside" if the worker spends approximately 75% or more of the time inside.
Math Skills: Requires mathematical development sufficient to be able to: Compute discount, interest, profit and loss, commission, markups and selling price, ratio and proportion, and percentages. Calculate surface, volumes, weights and measures.
Language Skills: Must have developed language skills to the point to be able to: Read newspapers, periodicals, journals, and manuals. Write business letters, summaries and reports using prescribed format and conforming to all rules of punctuation, grammar, diction and style. Participate in discussions and debates. Speak extemporaneously on a variety of subjects.
Relationships to Data, People and Things:
Data: Compiling: Gathering, collating, or classifying information about data, people or things. Reporting and/or carrying out a prescribed action in relation to the information is frequently involved.
People: Speaking-Signaling: Talking with and/or signaling people to convey or exchange information. Includes giving assignments and or directions to helpers or assistants.
Things: Operating-Controlling: Starting, stopping, controlling and adjusting the progress of machines or equipment. Operating machines involves setting up and adjusting the machine or materials as the work progresses. Controlling involves observing and turning devices to regulate reactions of materials.
Specific Vocational Preparation: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Professional with an emphasis on Word, PowerPoint and Excel to format and create professional documents to be used and distributed on the executive level. Candidate must have strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize duties to complete within required deadlines. Creativity to accomplish required tasks, such as documents being appealing to the eye, to find and research various information needed to complete and compile reports.

The Receptionist establishes rapport and maintains harmonious working relationships with administrators, teachers, staff members, families and students. It’s crucial that the Receptionist bring expertise, initiative, warmth, patience, energy, good judgment, and flexibility to the role and our community. Be completely present and conscious of the vibe you are projecting, leave personal agendas and belongings away from the front desk.

Be dependable, punctual and trustworthy
Must be willing to initiate tasks & perform duties without direction, including cleaning & tidying

REPORTS TO: Front Office Manager
Purpose for the Position: To check in and out guests to the hotel, ensure proper room and miscellaneous postings, secure credit, answer questions, answer telephones, provide maximum levels of guest service and support the hotel's rooms division in anyway required to ensure complete guest satisfaction.
Essential Responsibilities:
Greet, register, and assign rooms to guests of hotel.
Verify customers' credit, and establish how the customer will pay for the accommodation.
Keep records of room availability and guests' accounts using computerized property management systems.
Compute bills, collect payments, and make change for guests.
Perform simple bookkeeping activities, such as balancing cash accounts.
Issue room keys and escort instructions to bellmen.
Review accounts and charges with guests during the check out process.
Post charges, such those for rooms, food, liquor, or telephone calls, to ledgers manually, or by using computers.
Transmit and receive messages, using telephones or telephone switchboards.
Contact housekeeping or maintenance staff when guests report problems.
Make and confirm reservations.
Answer inquiries pertaining to hotel services, registration of guests, and shopping, dining, entertainment, and travel directions.
Record guest comments or complaints, referring customers to managers as necessary.
Advise housekeeping staff when rooms have been vacated and are ready for cleaning.
Answer all incoming phones in three or less rings.
Complete "bucket checks" to ensure all accounts are current and comply with standards established by the hotel's controller and front office manager.
To do this kind of work, you must be able to:
Be an outgoing, welcoming personality for the Hotel
Use logical thinking and personal judgment to perform a variety of office tasks that require special skills and knowledge.
Make decisions based on your own judgment and company policy.
Follow instructions without close supervision.
Speak and write clearly and accurately.
Be available for work days, evenings, weekends and holidays.
Physical Demands: Lifting 10 lbs. maximum and occasionally lifting and/or carrying such articles as dockets, ledgers, and small tools. Walking and standing are required throughout the shift. Reaching, handling, feeling, talking, hearing, and seeing.
Environmental Conditions: Inside: Protection from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes. A job is considered "inside" if the worker spends approximately 75% or more of the time inside.
Math Skills: Requires mathematical development sufficient to be able to: Compute discount, interest, profit and loss, commission, markups and selling price, ratio and proportion, and percentages. Calculate surface, volumes, weights and measures.
Language Skills: Must have developed language skills to the point to be able to: Read newspapers, periodicals, journals, and manuals. Write business letters, summaries and reports using prescribed format and conforming to all rules of punctuation, grammar, diction and style. Participate in discussions and debates. Speak extemporaneously on a variety of subjects.
Relationships to Data, People and Things:
Data: Compiling: Gathering, collating, or classifying information about data, people or things. Reporting and/or carrying out a prescribed action in relation to the information is frequently involved.
People: Speaking-Signaling: Talking with and/or signaling people to convey or exchange information. Includes giving assignments and or directions to helpers or assistants.
Things: Operating-Controlling: Starting, stopping, controlling and adjusting the progress of machines or equipment. Operating machines involves setting up and adjusting the machine or materials as the work progresses. Controlling involves observing and turning devices to regulate reactions of materials.
Specific Vocational Preparation: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Professional with an emphasis on Word, PowerPoint and Excel to format and create professional documents to be used and distributed on the executive level. Candidate must have strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize duties to complete within required deadlines. Creativity to accomplish required tasks, such as documents being appealing to the eye, to find and research various information needed to complete and compile reports.

Bond Vet is building the next generation of veterinary clinics from the ground up — and we’re looking for an enthusiastic Care Coordinator to join our team. We’re focused on urgent care, so we’re there for pets when they need us most. Our clinics are designed with pets and people in mind — they’re warm, friendly, and highly sniffable. We balance this design with a strong focus on technology, all built in-house, which means we can easily innovate our systems to improve the veterinary team, pet, and client experience. Our Care Coordinators support our patients as they come through the door. You’re the first and last touchpoint for our patients, so it’s imperative to make them feel welcome and comfortable.
What You’ll Do:
Greet pet parents and their four-legged friends.
Handle scheduling appointments.
Answer the phones.
Keep our common areas clean.
Communicate information to pet parent It’s not necessary to have previous veterinary experience — we will teach you everything you need to know and ensure you have ample opportunity to grow within our organization.
You’ll Fit In If:
You’re an animal lover.
You’re a team player.
You’re analytical and are driven by insights gleaned from data.
You’re a hands-on leader who can bring a vision to life.
You have intellectual curiosity when exploring issues.
You don’t shy away from a thoughtful debate.
You communicate clearly.
You learn from your mistakes.
You’re resourceful.
Our Values:
We’re obsessed with pets. The love we feel for animals drives us to do our best. We work with initiative, positivity and warmth to bridge the gap between human and pet, focusing on wellness to keep a better, stronger bond.
We work as a team. We’re knowledgeable, friendly, and passionate about a better veterinary experience. We jump at the opportunity to help one another and seek out opportunities to team up on tasks. We’re all in this together — our team, pet owners, and the animal — and our success as a team hinges on all of us doing our best.
We communicate clearly. We speak up, we do what we say, and we’re transparent and honest. We value clear, simple communication.
We work happy. We bring a happy, positive attitude to work because it impacts the energy in the office.
We’re empowered. We’re building a new kind of vet experience, and every team member is empowered to try new things and own their decision-making.
Our Promise to You:
We trust you. This is not a place where we micromanage. We took a tip from Steve Jobs: “It doesn't make sense to hire smart people and tell them what to do; we hire smart people so they can tell us what to do.” We hire smart people and give them ownership.
We offer great benefits (team-based bonuses, fantastic health, dental, and vision coverage, a One Medical membership, 16 week parental leave, continuing education, etc.). We don’t skimp here.
Mentorship is our priority — our team members are never alone, and we tackle challenges and questions together. 
We’re looking for people who are not just team players, but also leaders. If you’ve made it this far, you’re probably looking for something different than what’s already out there. So were we — let’s meet.
— Dr. Zay, Mo, Lukas, and the whole Bond Vet team Bond Vet provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.

Greet and register each patient as they arrive.
Verify patient demographics and insurance information.
Enter patient’s data into the EMR.
Collect any necessary co-payments and process accordingly.
Facilitate patient flow by notifying the provider of patients’ arrival, delays or backlogs and communicate this with other staff and patients, if need be.
Schedule patient appointments and obtain any necessary documentation that may be required for such an appointment.
Schedule any services or procedures as needed.
Maintain/prepare patient charts, physician schedules and confirm appointments one day prior to scheduled appointment.
Telephone patients if there is a change in the physician’s schedule and/or appointment needs to be rescheduled.

Murex is a recognized global leader in software development for trading, risk management and processing. Every day banks, asset managers, corporations and utilities, across the world, rely on Murex people and Murex solutions to support their capital markets activities. Our motto “pioneering again” sums it all up: since its creation, Murex has reinvented itself time and again to adapt to capital markets revolutions – each time offering innovative software solutions to the industry.
Over 2200 specialists are located across our 17 offices: Beijing, Beirut, Dubai, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Moscow, New York, Paris, Sao Paulo, Santiago, Seoul, Singapore, Sydney, Tokyo, and Toronto.
Why join us:
The Front Office consulting team is at the forefront of quantitative finance, providing cutting edge solutions for Capital Markets, including Derivatives Trading and Risk Management.
The team delivers personalized support to our clients by providing trading solutions involving quantitative models for pricing, trade processing and risk monitoring. Your responsibilities:
Provide proactive and high-quality support to Murex clients related to pricing, structuring, P&L and risk analysis tools, market data management and analytics.
Micro-analysis of financial products and derivatives trading activities.
Research and perform model validation of financial products, including vanilla and exotic derivatives.
Ensure successful follow-up on client cases, from notification to resolution and validation.
Understand the client business and deliver, within project timelines, a high-quality solution using Murex best practices. Preferred Qualifications and Attributes:
Strong background in mathematics. Master’s in quantitative finance is a plus.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrable interest in financial markets and technology
Strong sense of responsibility

Overview
The Welcome Team Member position provides a welcoming and safe environment for the members through high levels of customer service. The Welcome Team member’s interaction with members directly contributes to member retention and satisfaction.
The Welcome Team role achieves success through embodying our core competencies (Create the TSI Environment, Build a High Performing Team, Achieve Measurable Results). Create the TSI Environment Models the core attributes of a successful employee with the utmost integrity, lives the mission and empowers others to do the same; focused on building meaningful relationships with members, their kids and team members. Responsibilities include:
Modeling and promoting the Clubhouse Rules.
Adhering to all TSI policies and procedures including, but not limited to timeliness, codes of conduct, uniforms and timekeeping. Setting expectations around the same for team members. Setting expectations for team members. Build a High Performing Team Actively facilitates self and team member development; constantly seeking new ways to build skills and competency; elevates the brand experience. Responsibilities include:
Efficiently check in and handle routine member service tasks using the club systems such as (but not limited to) resetting passwords, updating credit cards and managing class reservations.
Navigating basic questions about membership, services and billing inquiries.
Providing a clean and organized Welcome Area at all times.
Being proficient in the use of MoSo, Club Networks, KRONOS, and any other computer program required to meet the business needs of the customer and TSI.
Providing high levels of customer service and attentiveness to member needs.
Being responsive to member feedback and complaints and escalating issues to club mgmt team as necessary.
Performing point of sale transactions.
Quickly addressing any maintenance or equipment issues that are visible to members.
Assisting GM in administrative tasks including (but not limited to) billing calls and confirming appointments. Achieve Measurable Results Meets and exceeds company goals and metrics surrounding employees and members; never satisfied with the status quo. Responsibilities include: Proactively seeking ways to positively influence the member experience and address member feedback.
Effectively communicating new promotions and services at point of contact, so that the member gets the most out of their gym membership. Requirements
Required Skills and Experience 1-2 years prior club experience in a member-facing role and/or prior customer service role.
Experience working with computer systems and navigating through work screens.
Physical demands include ability to walk through all areas of clubs, climbing stairs (where applicable), standing behind the front desk, and bending and lifting (e.g., picking up towels, restacking of weights, moving of equipment as necessary).
CPR/AED required within 30 days of hire for all opening & closing Welcome Team. (Preferred by all Welcome Team)

Let’s Connect
Are you ready to embark on a new career endeavor?
Join The Doe Fund on our mission to break the cycles of homelessness, addiction, and criminal recidivism by providing holistic services, housing and work opportunities to the under-served populations including the formerly homeless and incarcerated, disconnected youth, veterans, and people living with AIDS. Our flagship transitional work program- Ready, Willing & Able- integrates paid work, occupational training, and holistic supportive services to facilitate an individual’s return to mainstream society.
We are currently seeking an energetic, self-motivated and experienced Administrative Assistant for The Doe Fund's newest permanent supportive housing program for homeless men and women living with HIV/AIDS. The program is designed to provide long-term residential care and twenty-four hour support services in a community environment that maximizes residents' independence while ensuring their physical and emotional security and well-being. Seventy-four units will be allocated for residents referred by the New York City HIV/AIDS Services Administration (HASA) and forty-nine apartments will be for families referred by the New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA).
We offer a competitive salary with a comprehensive benefits including medical and dental coverage, paid participation in a retirement plan, sick and vacation leave, discount gym memberships, paid holidays and more.

You have a High School Diploma or GED
You have solid computer skills – internet and Microsoft Office

ProHEALTH is one of the largest private multi-specialty medical practices in the Northeast and has been serving the health needs of Long Island and the Greater New York Metropolitan area since 1997. With over 900 providers in 300 locations, our goal is to provide quality health care to ensure that our patients get the right care at the right time.
We’re a dynamic and growing health care organization, offering a wide range of employment opportunities. We are seeking professional and dedicated individuals to be part of our team, where integrity, compassion, relationships, innovation and performance are among our core principles.
We offer our employees competitive compensation and benefits, flexibility and opportunity for growth and advancement.
General Summary:
The receptionist works at the 'front line' of dental practices, as the first point of contact over the phone or on arrival. Responsibilities include booking patients, greeting visitors, sorting out appointments and undertaking other non-clinical tasks of an administrative nature as described below.
Responsibilities:
Greet patients in a warm and friendly manner.
Answer telephones pleasantly and professionally, take complete and accurate messages; follow up on messages, inquire and refer callers appropriately; ensure prompt delivery of messages.
Perform patient reminder calls.
Collect correct patient payments and understand how to read and calculate the ledger.
Maintain accurate dental records.
Works as a team member with staff, Dentist, Administrative and patient support teams.
Schedule appointments for office visits and procedures.
Perform pre-registration intake for new patients which includes name, address, date of birth, phone numbers, etc. and insurance ID (if applicable) prior to patient arrival at the office to determine eligibility and private co-payments.
Verify insurance for patient prior to day of appointment and provide explanation of benefits.
Collect treatment fees as well as discussing future financial arrangements.
Check answering machine for message and respond to same messages.
Maintain patient confidentiality as per HIPPA compliance.
Receive packages and lab cases.
Balancing day sheet and credit card machine at the end of each day.
Call patients to fill in no show and canceled visits (same day visits).
Understands basic dental coding and how to treatment plan basic procedures.
Maintain a clean and friendly reception area.
Maintain composure and professionalism when exposed to stressful situations.
Send and receive faxes.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
High School Diploma or equivalent
Knowledge of Dentrix and other relevant software applications
Knowledge of general administrative and clerical procedures
Working knowledge of dental insurance
Knowledge of dental terminology, procedures and diagnosis
Strong communication and customer service skills
ProHEALTH strives to maintain a workplace that accepts and appreciates the differences among our employees. The company will not discriminate against any applicant or employee based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, covered veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, status with respect to public assistance or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.


Overview
Engine is comprised of best-in-class specialist companies across a multitude of marketing disciplines across multiple channels. Engine is a new breed of marketing services network. We are more than a holding company - we are a culture and an approach. The current businesses that comprise Engine Group include market research, creative and marketing services, and digital content production, employing over 2,200 people worldwide.
Role
The research division seeks a master multi-tasker with excellent interpersonal skills, one who thrives in a fast-paced and growing environment, and is generally helpful and brings a positive presence to the workplace.
Responsibilities
General administrative duties, including: managing calendars, answering phones, travel arrangements, preparing expense reports, reconciling monthly credit card expenditures, organizing conferences and large group meetings.
Maintain up-to-date awareness of the executives' obligations in order to proactively assist and/or anticipate needs.
Maintain a demanding calendar; including appointment scheduling across multiple time zones.
Serve as liaison between executive staff and other Engine divisions and companies.
Participate in coordinating operational activities and corporate events within and outside the organization.
Draft correspondence, internal memoranda and e-mail communications.
Maintain highly confidential client files and contact records.
Submit travel and other business-related expenses for reimbursement, consistent with company policies.
Greet and assist visitors and key clients by providing administrative support as necessary, including travel, hotel accommodations, and restaurant reservations, etc.
Be proactive and stay informed of company administrative policies and issues.
Provide assistance on research projects and other projects as need.
Provide support to Facilities team and rotate reception area coverage.
Perform other administrative responsibilities as needed.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and related experience required.
3 - 5 years experience as an administrative assistant.
Candidate must be able to work independently while managing multiple projects.
Ability to multi-task and have excellent follow-through
Self-starter with the ability to prioritize, organize and establish administrative procedures.
Ability to handle confidential information and interact with high-level executives.
Comfortable and confident working in different time zones and with various cultures.
Ability to work in a high pressure and dynamic environment while maintaining a calm demeanor.
Ability to think through, evaluate and solve problems logically.
Ability to organize work effectively in order to meet deadlines.
Conduct all matters in a professional and courteous manner.
Flexible schedule required.
Impeccable oral and written communication skills are a must.
Must be extremely organized, detail-oriented and a team player.
Strong typing skills of 60 wpm. Proficient on PC and Mac, with solid skills in Microsoft Office.
